title: C++ Level 8 â€” Sets and Membership
concept: Use std::set to track unique values, intersections, and membership checks.

challenges.title: Distinct Numbers Count
challenges.description: Given N and N integers, determine how many distinct numbers there are.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Common Elements Count
challenges.description: Given two lists of integers, count how many distinct numbers appear in both lists.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers, then M, then M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: count of distinct numbers common to both lists.

challenges.title: Common Elements Sorted
challenges.description: Given two lists, print all distinct numbers that appear in both, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers, then M, then M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Common distinct elements in ascending order separated by spaces.

challenges.title: Seen Before (Numbers)
challenges.description: Given N and a sequence of N integers, for each element print YES if this number has appeared earlier in the sequence, otherwise NO.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: N lines: each line YES or NO.
examples:
Input:
6
1 2 1 2 3 2

Output:
NO
NO
YES
YES
NO
YES

tests.expected:
NO
NO
YES
YES
NO
YES

challenges.title: Numbers Only in First List
challenges.description: Print distinct numbers that appear only in the first list and not in the second, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers, then M, then M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Numbers belonging only to first list, sorted ascending, separated by spaces.

challenges.title: Numbers Only in Second List
challenges.description: Print distinct numbers that appear only in the second list and not in the first, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers, then M, then M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Numbers belonging only to second list, sorted ascending.

challenges.title: Union of Two Lists
challenges.description: Given two lists, print all distinct numbers that appear in at least one list, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers, then M, then M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Distinct union elements in ascending order separated by spaces.

challenges.title: Distinct Words in Text
challenges.description: Given n lines of text, print the number of distinct words (case-sensitive). Words are separated by spaces.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: integer n. Next n lines: text.

challenges.title: Seen Before (Words)
challenges.description: Given a line of words, for each word print how many times it has appeared before it in the same line. Words are separated by spaces.
challenges.outputDescription: For each word, print an integer count on the same line separated by spaces.
examples:
Input:
one two one two two

Output:
0 0 1 1 2

challenges.title: Alice and Bob Cubes
challenges.description:
Alice has N cubes, Bob has M cubes. Each cube has an integer color. Find:
1) Colors both have,
2) Colors only Alice has,
3) Colors only Bob has.
For each of the three sets, print on its own line: first the count, then the sorted colors.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers; M, then M integers.
examples: Example: if Alice: {1,2,3}, Bob: {2,3,4}, then line1: 2 2 3, line2: 1 1, line3: 1 4.
